entry.title: Embedded SAP EWM - CKMDUVMAT
entry.content: In embedded SAP EWM, has anyone used t-code CKMDUVMAT for automate distribution of inventory Differences to Production orders, when Physical Inventory happens in EWM Storage location? Is it feasible?

entry.title: Getting Short dump while trying to delete BIN in SAP EWM
entry.content:
Hello Team,

1. We are not able to delete Storage bin in our warehouse 0028. Storage type- LG15, Storage bin-   A-17-3-0

2. While trying to delete we are getting  ASSERTION_FAILED in short dump we can see below error.

If the error occurs in one of your own ABAP programs or an SAP program
that you have modified, try to correct the error yourself.
If the error occurs in a non-modfied SAP program, you might be able to
find a solution in the SAP Notes system. If you have access to the SAP
Notes system, check there first using the following keywords:

"ASSERTION_FAILED"
"/LIME/SAPLCORE" bzw. /LIME/LCORENOI
"SELECT_NODE"
If you cannot solve the problem yourself, please send the following
information to SAP:

1. The description of the problem (short dump)
To do this, choose  System -> List -> Save -> Local File (unconverted)
on the screen you are in now.

2. The relevant system log
To do this, call the system log in transaction SM21. Restrict the time
interval to ten minutes before the short dump and five minutes after
it. In the display, choose System -> Lis

entry.title: We are using SAP S4 HANA 2023 version. Product Group Type and Product group is not visible in MM02.
entry.content: We are using S4 HANA 2023 version. We need to use Product group type and product group to configure Cross Docking. But  found that Product Group Type and Product group is not visible in MM02. Please note that since 2023 these 2 fields re not available in /SAPAPO/MAT1. Your help is appreciated.

entry.title: Catch Weight in SAP EWM
entry.content:
Dear Community,

The functionality 'Catch Weight' in SAP EWM, is this available in both the basic license as advanced? Or would the advanced license be required to use this functionality within SAP EWM?

entry.title: Understanding Non Valuated Stock and Text Items in SAP MM/EWM: Business Purpose and System Behavior
entry.content: I need clarification on the real business use and purpose of non valuated stock in SAP MM and EWM. What does non valuation actually mean in practice, and in which business processes does it make sense to manage physical stock without assigning a value? I would appreciate concrete examples, including who ultimately pays for these materials and how their consumption is handled financially and in the SAP EWM. I also want to understand whether packaging materials are always non valuated, and if not, what drives that decision. Additionally, since EWM still requires a product and stock representation, how does EWM handle non valuated materials compared to MM? Finally, I want to confirm the concept of text items in SAP EWM, since my understanding is that they do not create deliveries or warehouse tasks, and I would like to know if there are any nuances or exceptions.

entry.title: Custom verification logic for RF transaction in Public Cloud WM
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are on Public Cloud WM and use RF devices in our warehouse for Inbound / Replenishment process,

One of the requirement is to verify the product using the supplier's barcode printed on the box.

However this barcode is a combination of supplier code + product number + qty (separated by a unique separator) concatenated.

Is there any option / mechanism in Public Cloud WM by which we can decode the product number upon verification of the barcode on the RF device against Product verification field?

Your ideas will be much appreciated.

Regards,

Shashi

entry.title: S4 Public Cloud Custom RF verification
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Please suggest if it is possible to add a custom verification logic for one of the fields on RF(example : product - decode product number from a suppliers barcode - barcode consists of other fields as well, not just product).

Regards,

Shashi

entry.title: Differentiate free-of-charge vs standard deliveries at outbound delivery header in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are working in an SAP Public Cloud environment and facing the following challenge in the Warehouse Monitor:
Outbound delivery documents use the same delivery type (LF) for both processes – standard sales and free-of-charge deliveries. At the outbound delivery header, we cannot find any field or criterion to differentiate these two types of deliveries.

The only difference we currently see is at the item level, where the item category differs:

  • TAN = standard sales
  • CBXN = free-of-charge delivery

However, there is no way to distinguish them at the header level, and in SAP Public Cloud there is a restriction that we cannot create a new delivery type.

Question:
Is there any way to differentiate free-of-charge deliveries from standard sales deliveries at the outbound delivery header in EWM? Can we add a custom field or use another approach (e.g., BAdI, extensibility options)? Has anyone faced this scenario and found a solution in the Public Cloud environment?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: IOT2 SAP EWM QM
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We want to implement IOT2 (counting with EWM QM) process in decentralised enviroment but not aware of the process flow.(business flow is clear but SAP process flow is not clear)

We have already implemented IOT4 (with and without POSC). We have started the configuration steps for IOT2 as well, below are already completed-

1) IOT2 activation

2) No range assignment for IOT2

3) Define and activate warehouse dependent IOT's 

4) Defne quality index

5) Inspection rule set up for product/ IOT2(counting)

Can you please help us in mapping IOT2 (both explicit and implicit) with the process steps and also let us know if any other configurations steps are missing?

Regards,

Chinmaya Patnaik

entry.title: SAP S4 HANA screen personas P icon is mising
entry.content:
We have installed the Personas component in our S4 HANA 2023 on prem environment and a given the access with below roles 

 Administrator - /personas/admin_role - full rights

Editor - /personas/editor_role - full access to the client, Themes, but not the Administrative UI.

Consumer - /personas/consumer_role - for read-only access to SAP Screen Personas Flavors

Even then unable to see the Persona P icon.

entry.title: /SCWM/MFS_SIM_RECEIVE not working - no Telegram sent
entry.content:
Hello together,

 

I would be super grateful for some advice. We are currently using /SCWM/MFS_SIM_RECEIVE to simulate the telegrams for EWM MFS. I checked all the settings in /SCWM/MFS_PLC and also restarted the communication channels, but the function module does not seem to work, as despite sending several telegrams, never an answer telegram was sent. The acknowldgement telegrams were received but not the expected answer telegram. Would you have any idea, what is missing or if there are any wrong settings?

 

Thank you very much in advance

entry.title: Full Pallet vs Partial Picking with Different Destination Areas
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on an SAP EWM outbound picking scenario and need guidance on the standard configuration approach.

Business requirement:

  • If the delivery quantity equals the full pallet (full HU), the system should pick the entire HU directly to the Staging Area.

  • If the delivery quantity is partial, the system should pick the partial quantity to an Operations Area, where:

    • the source pallet is opened (deconsolidation),

    • a new destination HU is created for the picked quantity,

    • the remaining quantity stays in the source HU.

We are doing this in wave Management where once wave is released WO/WT will create. If picking quantity is > Pallet the complete HU should be picked. If < then Pallet will picked and moved to operatonal Area where Partial picking is done in new HU

Regards,

Chand

entry.title: Production Material Staging with Batch Characteristics
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on Production Material Staging (PMR) in SAP EWM.

Scenario:

  • Production Order is created in SAP S/4HANA

  • PMR is generated in SAP EWM

  • Staging is triggered from the PMR

During staging, the system should select batches based on specific batch characteristics (for example: quality parameters, production date, or custom batch characteristics), and stage only those batches that match the defined criteria.

As of now we are doing manually, is there any standard configuration where system can select batches based on the certain characteristics.

Regards,

Chand.

entry.title: SAP EWM Cloud – Handling Unit Management for Inbound Raw Materials Without Repacking
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on an SAP S/4HANA Cloud – EWM (Warehouse Management) implementation and need guidance on Handling Unit (HU) management for inbound raw materials.

Business Requirement

  • Raw materials are received from vendors already packed in:

    • Plastic Drums

    • Carboys

    • Carton Boxes

    • Bags

  • No repacking is allowed in the warehouse.

  • Each physical packing unit must be treated as one HU:

    • 1 Drum = 1 HU

    • 1 Carboy = 1 HU

    • 1 Carton Box = 1 HU

  • Warehouse team wants to:

    • Perform Goods Receipt HU-wise

    • Execute putaway, stock management, and loading HU-wise

  • Quantity is maintained inside the HU (e.g., KG or LTR inside one drum).

Current Understanding

  • HUs should be created at Goods Receipt

  • Packing material type should represent Drum / Carboy / Carton

  • No HU consolidation or repacking activities are required

  • HU should remain unchanged until goods issue

My Questions

  1. What is the recommended configuration approach in SAP EWM Cloud to achieve this scenario?

  2. Should HUs be:

    • Created automatically during GR based on packaging specification?

    • Or created manually during inbound processing?

  3. How should packing materials (drum, carboy, carton) be modeled in EWM Cloud?

  4. Is Packaging Specification mandatory for this scenario, or can it be handled without it?

  5. Are there any best practices or limitations in EWM Cloud for HU-managed inbound without repacking?

Any guidance, configuration pointers, or practical examples would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your support.

Best regards,
Adil

entry.title: Mapping Stock to New Nested Handling Units Using Migration Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Mapping Stock to New Nested Handling Units Using Migration Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

Step 1: Go to the ‘Migrate Your Data’ tile and create a project by selecting the ‘HUM – Handling Unit’ object.

Img:1

Img:2

Img:3

Img:4

Step 2: Once the project is created, select the project and download the migration template.

 

Step 3: Fill in the required data in the tabs of the template. The detailed steps are provided below.

Tab 1: Bundles for Nested HUs

  • Maintain a Run ID when creating Nested HUs for a material.
  • The Run ID is used to group multiple Handling Units into a single Nested HU structure.

Example: If a carton containing material is packed together with other cartons onto a pallet, the cartons (inner HUs) and the pallet (outer HU) together form a Nested Handling Unit structure and must share the same Run ID (Bundle ID).

Tab 2: Header Data

  • Since an external number range is maintained in the backend configuration for HU packing types, the External HU ID is filled for the respective packing materials, Plant details.

Tab 3: Item Data

  • Maintain the material against the respective HU ID and enter the quantity to be migrated into the new Handling Units.

Scenario example used in this document:

  • At Pallet HU level, the Carton Box HU is assigned.
  • At Carton Box HU level, the Small Box HU is assigned.
  • At the Small Box HU level, the material “42 – SFG Material” is maintained with a quantity of 15 KG.

When this data is uploaded, the system:

  • Automatically assigns the stock to the respective HUs, and Creates the complete Nested HU structure, finally resulting in the Pallet HU containing all lower-level HUs.

Step 4: Upload File and Mapping Task

  • Upload the completed data template.

 

Step 5: Simulate

Step 6: Migrate

  • Finally, migration completed, the system creates the Handling Units (HUs) and assigns them to the existing stock for the material.

Check Stock: Display Stock Overview

  • The below screenshot confirms successful creation of Nested HUs, with stock correctly assigned from Small Box → Carton Box → Pallet HU.

  • Using Migration Cockpit, we successfully mapped existing stock into a nested HU structure, enabling accurate HU tracking and improved stock visibility in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
